definition: to wake up/to be awake/to become aware/to sober up/to come to

sentences.english: The next morning, after sleeping off his drunkenness, the bandit chief woke up sober.
sentences.chinese: 第二天早晨，强盗头一觉之后酒醒了人也清醒了。

sentences.english: I've seen Fara defend herself against a few drunken ruffians .
sentences.chinese: 我曾经看过法拉在抵抗一些酒醒的无赖。

sentences.english: Yan had no information on the enemy, sober Canmeng send bleak.
sentences.chinese: 雁过故人无信息，酒醒残梦寄凄凉。

sentences.english: Sober sat only in the flowers, but also to spend the next drunken sleep.
sentences.chinese: 酒醒只在花前坐，酒醉还来花下眠。

sentences.english: Eu non-success wine woke up, surprised at Yu Fan home for the night.
sentences.chinese: 薇芸酒醒后，惊讶在余凡家过夜。

sentences.english: You will ashamed what you've done after you drink.
sentences.chinese: 你酒醒之后，会为你的所作所为而感到羞愧。

sentences.english: Hindley descended more leisurely, sobered and abashed.
sentences.chinese: 辛德雷从容不迫地下来，酒醒了，也觉得羞愧了。

sentences.english: In wine, and full waking lotus pond people move autumn wind.
sentences.chinese: 夜半酒醒人不觉，满池荷叶动秋风。

definition: after drinking/under the influence of alcohol
dead drunk/as drunk as a lord
fragment/piece/(of a film) to break in the middle of viewing
to dissipate the effects of alcohol/to sober up
lit. as drunk as mud/completely drunk
